edu.iu.dsc.tws.api.tset.sets

Interface AcceptingData<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - tset type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BatchTSet<T>, BatchTupleTSet<K,V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BatchTSetImpl, BatchTupleTSetImpl, CachedTSet, CheckpointedTSet, ComputeTSet, KeyedCachedTSet, KeyedCheckpointedTSet, KeyedPersistedTSet, KeyedSourceTSet, KeyedStoredTSet, KeyedTSet, PersistedTSet, SinkTSet, SourceTSet, StoredTSet

    public interface AcceptingData<T>
    Adds the capability for TSets to accept data from another TSet as an input. Only the Batch TSets can accept inputs.

    This remains as a separate interface because SinkTSet behaves differently to all other BatchTSets. i.e. It does not expose any communication operations. But a SinkTSet needs to be able to accept data from another TSet. Therefore, that capability was separated out.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TBase addInput(java.lang.String key, StorableTBase<?> input)
      Allows users to pass in other TSets as inputs for a TSet

               StorableTBase<?> input)
        Allows users to pass in other TSets as inputs for a TSet
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to store the given TSet
        input - a StorableTBase TSet to be added as an input
        Returns:
        this TSet
